components.description:
An icon used to represent a cyclone. Some versions of this emoji show a spiral shape, which may be used for decorative purposes.

This emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, possibly in an attempt to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.
components.title: Cyclone

description:
An icon used to represent a cyclone. Some versions of this emoji show a spiral shape, which may be used for decorative purposes.

This emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, possibly in an attempt to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.
title: Cyclone

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Weather, landscape, and sky symbols

emoji_net_data.name: cyclone

bn:00099977a: In the shape of a coil
In the shape of a helix.
In the shape of a coil.
In the shape of a helix

bn:00101649a: Dizzy, feeling dizzy or unsteady and as if about to fall down.
Having or causing a whirling sensation; liable to falling
Having a sensation of whirling, with a tendency to fall; giddy; feeling unbalanced or lightheaded.
Having a sensation of turning around.
Having a sensation of whirling and a tendency to fall.

bn:00098485a: (of events) having extremely unfortunate or dire consequences; bringing ruin- Charles Darwin- Douglas MacArthur
Causing great distress or injury; bringing ruin.

bn:00092315v: To act or speak in heightened anger.
Behave violently, as if in state of a great anger
To act or speak violently, as if in state of a great anger.
To move quickly and noisily like a storm, usually in a state of uproar or anger.

bn:00087479v: Flow in a circular current, of liquids

bn:00089137v: Revolve quickly and repeatedly around one's own axis
To revolve round a central point; to move spirally about an axis, as a tornado; to revolve.

bn:00085266v: To wind or move in a spiral course

bn:00094689v: Turn in a twisting or spinning motion
To turn in a twisting or spinning motion.

bn:00094133v: To move along the path of a spiral or helix.

bn:00024743n: (meteorology) rapid inward circulation of air masses about a low pressure center; circling counterclockwise in the northern hemisphere and clockwise in the southern
A storm characterized by the converging and rising giratory movement of the wind around a zone of low pressure (the eye) towards which it is violently pulled from a zone of high pressure.
In meteorology, a cyclone is an area of closed, circular fluid motion rotating in the same direction as the Earth.
A system of winds rotating around a center of low atmospheric pressure.

bn:00027951n: Vertigo is a subtype of dizziness in which a patient inappropriately experiences the perception of motion due to dysfunction of the vestibular system.
The state of being dizzy; the sensation of instability.
The state of being off balance
A sensation of irregular or whirling motion, either of oneself or of external objects.
Dizziness is an impairment in spatial perception and stability.
Lightheadedness is a common and typically unpleasant sensation of dizziness and/or a feeling that one may faint.
A sensation of whirling and loss of balance, caused by looking down from a great height or by disease affecting the inner ear.
Vertigo is a 1958 film about a San Francisco detective and his psychological troubles with a fear of heights and an obsession over a woman.
A reeling sensation; a feeling that you are about to fall

bn:00007520n: The rotation angle about the longitudinal axis.
The Euler angles are three angles introduced by Leonhard Euler to describe the orientation of a rigid body.
The rotation angle about the longitudinal axis
Rotary motion of an object around its own axis

bn:03178421n: In fluid dynamics, an eddy is the swirling of a fluid and the reverse current created when the fluid flows past an obstacle.
A current of a fluid running back, or in a direction contrary to the main current.
A current of air or water running back, or in an opposite direction to the main current.
Air or water running in an opposite direction to the main current.

bn:00006808n: The atmospheric conditions that comprise the state of the atmosphere in terms of temperature and wind and clouds and precipitation
The day-to-day meteorological conditions, especially temperature, cloudiness, and rainfall, affecting a specific place.
Unpleasant or destructive atmospheric conditions, and their effects.
Weather is the state of the atmosphere, to the degree that it is hot or cold, wet or dry, calm or stormy, clear or cloudy.

bn:00052661n: A maelstrom is a very powerful whirlpool; a large, swirling body of water.
A powerful circular current of water (usually the result of conflicting tides)
A rapidly rotating body of water.
In fluid dynamics, a vortex is a region, in a fluid medium, in which the flow is mostly rotating on an axis line, the vortical flow that occurs either on a straight-axis or a curved-axis.
A whirlpool is a swirling body of water produced by the meeting of opposing currents.
A whirlwind, whirlpool, or similarly moving matter in the form of a spiral or column.

bn:00077667n: A violent windstorm characterized by a twisting, funnel-shaped cloud.
A localized and violently destructive windstorm occurring over land characterized by a funnel-shaped cloud extending toward the ground
A rapidly rotating column of air developed around a very intense low-pressure centre.
A tornado is a violently rotating column of air that is in contact with both the surface of the earth and a cumulonimbus cloud or, in rare cases, the base of a cumulus cloud.
Violently rotating column of air that is in contact with both the earth's surface and a cumulonimbus cloud
A tornado with an exceptionally long path length; for example, 160 km (100 mi) or longer
A tornado is a violently rotating column of air, in contact with the ground, either pendant from a cumuliform cloud or underneath a cumuliform cloud, and often visible as a funnel cloud.

bn:00073419n: A plane curve traced by a point circling about the center but at increasing distances from the center

bn:00078817n: A severe tropical cyclone in the western Pacific.

A weather phenomenon in the Eastern Pacific that is precisely equivalent to a hurricane, which results in wind speeds of 64 knots (118km/h) or above. Equivalent to a cyclone in the Indian Ocean and Indonesia/Australia.
A tropical cyclone occurring in the western Pacific or Indian oceans

A typhoon is a mature tropical cyclone that develops in the western part of the North Pacific Ocean between 180 Â° and 100 Â° E. This region is referred to as the Northwestern Pacific Basin, and is the most active tropical cyclone basin on Earth, accounting for almost one-third of the world's annual tropical cyclones.

apple_vendor_description: The cyclone emoji on Apple devices is depicted as a swirling vortex of deep blues and grays, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading that gives it a tangible, dynamic presence. Realistic lighting emphasizes the turbulent motion, with soft rounded edges on the cloud formations suggesting immense power. It visually conveys a sense of chaos, overwhelming force, or a dramatic, unpredictable event in digital conversations.
